info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 10 at 5:24PM CDT until July 10 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
At 523 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over University Heights, or over Iowa City, moving east at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees.
Locations impacted include... Iowa City, Coralville, North Liberty, Tiffin, University Heights, Hills, Oakdale, Lake Macbride State Park, Iowa City Municipal Airport, Sugar Bottom Camp Ground, Johnson County Fairgrounds, Cosgrove, West Overlook, University Of Iowa, Sharon Center, and Coralville Lake Dam Complex.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 232 and 250. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 4.
info.instruction:
A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room.
Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.
Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL JOHNSON COUNTY
